title: Macedonia
content: The region that lay north of Achaia and south of what are now called the Balkan Mountains. It was the first part of Europe in which Paul preached the gospel (

) and contained many well-known places, such as Neapolis, Philippi, Thessalonica, and Berea. Macedonia and Thessaly together constituted a Roman Province under the government of a proconsul, who lived at Thessalonica.
